links.*: The Disaster of the Gladden Fields

wikitext.*:
'''Iris''' was a colourful and distinctive flower. [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] found it growing in [[Ithilien]],<ref>{{TT|IV4}}</ref> and the [[Gladden River]] and the [[Gladden Fields]] took their name from a variety of this flower.<ref>{{UT|Gladden}}, note 13</ref>

==Notes==
The "iris-swords" mentioned in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' are a reference to its thin, pointed leaves. In [[Letter 297]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] identifies the flower as the ''[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iris_pseudacorus Iris pseudacorus]''.<ref>{{L|297}}</ref>
